alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southeastern Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:23PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN BIG HORN AND SOUTHEASTERN CARBON COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM MDT... At 622 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of Crooked Creek Natural Area, or 20 miles north of Lovell, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Big Horn and southeastern Carbon Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Canyon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southeastern Carbon
